Description: Rim sherd of large Attic black-glazed pottery vessel (e.g. large stemmed bowl or plate); flaring rim with broad and concave upper surface and slightly convex outer edge; glazed black on exterior and inside; reserved outer face of foot and concave upper surface; inscriptions cut on outer face and upper surface.
Curator's comments: It is also possible that this may be from a hydria.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1315)
